attributes.action: Ban Smacking In England
attributes.background: Smacking isn’t needed and many times it has been proven by specialists that smacking isn’t needed to correct bad behavior. It’s time to ban it and humanely educate our kids to behave without hitting them.

attributes.action: Licence possession of all knives that have potential to harm.
attributes.background: Our licensing laws forbid guns in our drawers, so why can't our government push for a change? License the manufacturing and possession of potential weapons. Rounded edge knives only unless licensed.

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication

attributes.action: People  who take  in animals  by law should  check  for a microchip.
attributes.background: All animals  picked up should be taken  by  law to get checked  for  a microchip.
attributes.additional_details: I live in the w14 area  and in the last 6 weeks I have discovered  that  12 cats have  gone  missing  in 6 week's all from good  homes all  sprayed mirichipped  adult cats.

attributes.action: Online retail companies should pay an equivalent to UK high street rates.
attributes.background:
The High Street is suffering, losing thousands of jobs because online suppliers offer low paid jobs in distribution centres that pay minimal local business rates.
 
Many pay low corporation tax and again gain an unfair advantage over British and other tax paying businesses
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/02/amazon-halved-uk-corporation-tax-bill-to-45m-last-year
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45053528
 
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/amazon-now-pay-even-less-13023482
 
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/998509/amazon-uk-tax-high-street-shops-business-tax-income-tax-taxation-system
 
https://www.ft.com/content/8fcf026e-38e0-11e8-8b98-2f31af407cc8

attributes.action: Grant full time students access to a Maternity Allowance
attributes.background: Many full time students who fall pregnant or give birth during their studies, are unable to access statutory maternity pay or allowance. These are one of the few groups of women who are missing out on their maternity rights. Let’s give full time students access to maternity allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of access occurs when a student hasn’t worked in the qualifying period - you can see how that works here (see maternity allowance and statutory maternity pay): 
https://www.staffsunion.com/advice/money/financeguides/parents/

We suggest full time students should automatically have access to maternity allowance or that a special allowance be drawn up to accommodate these cases that provides equivalent support.

attributes.action: Ban the use of premium rate phone numbers completely.
attributes.background: These numbers are charged at a truly enormous rate and  there seems to be no legitimate need for these at all.

attributes.action: Reconsider blood donation guidelines affecting female partners of bisexual men
attributes.background:
Currently NHS blood donation excludes female partners of bisexual men from donating blood. 

You must not give blood or platelets for at least 3 months after sex
(If you are a woman) a man who has ever had oral or anal sex with another man, even if they used a condom or other protective.
attributes.additional_details:
This excludes women whose only long term partner is a man if their partner has ever had sex with another man. Despite this, a bisexual male partner can give blood if it has been 3 months since the last instance of sexual contact with a male. Exceptions may be made if the male partner is willing or able to attend an appointment as well.

This petition requests that guidelines be reconsidered to allow women who have had sex with men who have slept with other men but not in the past 6 months.

attributes.action: Make retailers to offer unpacking, packaging collection with home delivery items
attributes.background:
The amount of packages being delivered at homes, dispatched from big warehouses.
Excessive non recyclable packaging are damaged and end in landfills and stretches the capacity of local civic body. Collection of these materials by the retailer would encourage responsible packaging and recycling.

attributes.action: Require all CCGs to offer IVF for co-parenting parents
attributes.background: Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) decide IVF policies. Despite NICE stating that “the existence of living children should not be a factor that precludes the provision of fertility treatment”, this guidance isn’t mandatory and the result is a postcode lottery.
attributes.additional_details: We have recently been refused IVF by our local CCG because we are co-parents. Make it fair so IVF is available on the NHS to all co-parenting parents!

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of plastic used in the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.background: Governors at our school were shocked when shown the amount of plastic not only used, but also thrown away during the administration of the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of plastic used to keep the papers secure is largely unnecessary, added to which the number of bags within bags needed for the returns process is excessive, and contrary to the current public drive to reduce such waste.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile phones while driving an instant driving ban.
attributes.background:
As an approved driving instructor Every day i see drivers using their phones Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving
I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive
attributes.additional_details: I  firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive.making it difficult to get to work without a car . If  put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone while driving.

attributes.action: Require restaurants to give a range of vegan and vegetarian options by law
attributes.background: As it stands there is no actual law that states restaurants must provide vegan and vegetarian options. Veganism is on the rise and gaining real growth as its own lifestyle. most of us feel unfairly treated when our options are greatly limited and social interactions are in decline as a result
attributes.additional_details:
The other reasons are simple. While I firmly believe killing animals is wrong and that a plant based diet brings great benefits I accept not everyone will change. But I do believe that everyone is happy to try or at least take pressure away from the animal farming industry. 
The killing of animals for food and the use of what they provide has been linked to cancer, diabetes and other awful diseases by some studies. We pay millions in treating these.

attributes.action: Introduce a law to fit microchips in every ammunition round produced in the UK
attributes.background: With gun crime on the rise in the UK, it makes sense to try to detect those people carrying ammunition by means of a detection device worn by anyone with a reason to do so e.g. Police officers. A gun with no ammunition cannot kill.
attributes.additional_details: This will take time, but will reap benefits in years to come once existing stocks have depleted. This would need a small hand held device that could be worn by security officials that will send a vibrating alarm to the wearer and log the GPS location and serial numbers of all ammunition read by the microchips. The microchips would be similar to those used in dogs, only the size of a grain of rice. They would be inserted, by law into the gunpowder of every round made.

attributes.action: Ban homework and only have revision
attributes.background: Homework can cause stress and even mental health issues for students. They have no time for their personal life and just revising would be more effective for exams.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to have a dog off lead on or near any public highway.
attributes.background: To protect the general public,drivers, other dog walkers and their dogs, all dogs, no matter how well behaved they may be, should be kept on a lead on or near any road.
attributes.additional_details: I have had three incidents myself recently involving loose dogs, which have been frightening for myself and my dog, but also which could have resulted in accident or injuries. In one incident a dog ran accross a busy road to get to mine, the owner said 'sorry, but he's friendly' - lucky he wasn't 'dead friendly'. I also know personally of several cases where dogs have been attacked by loose dogs, one of which was on their own driveway. Sadly the owners seem to think this is acceptable behaviour.

attributes.action: Ban child targeted advertising on unhealthy foods.
attributes.background: We have a huge obesity problem in the UK, yet we're targeting young children when selling unhealthy foods. Walking around the supermarket, I regularly see chocolate bars with Paw Patrol characters on the wrappers. This is shocking and needs to be stopped if we have any chance in tackling obesity.

attributes.action: Government to fund a rail/bus discount card for those in education until age 18.
attributes.background: My friend's 16-year-old daughter is starting college this year and will need to travel by train and as there is no other alternative she has had to purchase an adult season ticket at huge expense.
attributes.additional_details:
As all children are expected to remain in education until the age of 18 it is unfair that their parents should have to pay full adult rail and bus fares for them.

Because our train and bus companies are all privately owned it is very difficult to ask them to change their policies, however, I do believe that the Government has a duty of care to all students and those undertaking low paid apprenticeships and I would like to ask Government to consider funding a student/young persons rail/bus discount card thereby helping to reduce travelling costs for parents.

attributes.action: Suspend foreign aid until the national debt has been payed off.
attributes.background: We have a national debt to service, if we give 14.5 billion by 2021 in foreign aid we are borrowing money to give away whilst we lack funds for domestic programs

attributes.action: Prevent shops from selling or advertising Christmas product until advent starts.
attributes.background: Christmas is a special time of year for children, however, the magic is being diluted due to trade and commerce. It is August 2018 and already there are Christmas products on display in shops in the UK. This is absurd. Christmas advertising should be restricted by legislation to advent.
attributes.additional_details: Yesterday (14/08/18) I saw Santa toys for sale in Poundland. Other people have reported products in Tesco. This world is hard enough for todays children without depriving them of the one magical period each year to look forward to, without making them bored of Christmas songs by mid November. I accept businesses need to plan in advance for such a profitable period but the public face of Christmas should be reserved until advent.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of gambling advertisements like the banning of tobacco commercials
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to support people that are suffering from the severity of gambling addiction. Through numerous means, gambling organisations are targeting and taking advantage of  vulnerable gambling addicts by bombarding them with the temptation to give in to their impulses.
attributes.additional_details:
For the serious addict- a slogan that says 'When the Fun Stops, Stop' on the bottom of gambling adverts is not enough to rid any real impulse. The addict that is actively working on their recovery can find a single advert on the internet or TV extremely triggering.

The government has a responsibility to protect it's citizens in the face of corporations that are tactically taking advantage of addicts, particularly where gambling is readily available with a few taps on our mobile devices.

attributes.action: Make sensory rooms compulsory in schools and provide separate funding for it.
attributes.background: CAMHS is in a serious and worsening crisis and it is failing our children.   The first step to helping our children would be to equip our schools with sensory rooms.  This will be the foundation block for children with specialist learning needs, including autism and learning disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
Sensory rooms in schools will benefit our children hugely.  Please give your full support
https://www.experia-innovations.co.uk/blog/the-benefits-of-a-sensory-room/   
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/nhs-mental-health-services-children-turn-away-day-vulnerable-nspcc-study-a8047401.html
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/oct/24/mental-health-children-camhs-jeremy-hunt-nhs-tragedies-funding-cuts
What is a sensory room
https://www.green-modular.com/blog/sensory-rooms-schools/

attributes.action: Limit MP's to a total of 4 years in parliament to prevent career politicians.
attributes.background: A politician should only be allowed to serve 4 years (consecutive or not) in parliament to prevent the blatant complacency and contempt for the British public that has been on display for years.
attributes.additional_details:
A politician with a limited timescale has to make their term count. Would the country stall on any major decision if politicians knew they could do what they believed was best for the country without fear of losing their ‘golden goose’ career? 
Fresh blood is required to bring new ideas and a fresh perspective to the way this country is run. New and exciting representatives are out there waiting for their chance to make a difference for the country, and they should be given the chance.

attributes.action: Remove the 'minimum ban' on drink drivers and replace with a lifetime ban
attributes.background:
Currently the law in the UK states that drink driving offenders MAY GET, 6 months’ imprisonment, 
an unlimited fine, a driving ban for at least 1 year (3 years if convicted twice in 10 years)
attributes.additional_details:
These dangerous people should be taken off the road for good and the penalties for those who offend should be a lot stricter. An example must be made.
Almost 1 in 4 drink driving offenders return to court for the same offence in the UK.

attributes.action: Government to make lie detector tests compulsory for suspects.
attributes.background: The main aim of this petition is to persuade government and parliament to make lie detector tests complusory on suspects also lie detector tests should be carried out without the permission of suspects as a routine check.
attributes.additional_details: Innocent lives are lost and the families want to find out who the suspect may have been. Cases of crime and violence will be easier to resolve and justice will be given to innocent families.

attributes.action: Portable barbecues, not disposed of safely, start wildfires. Restrict their sale
attributes.background: Many wildfires start with a hot disposable barbecue left to smoulder. They should be sold responsibly with clear, robust advice about the risks. And proper advice about the very real risk of wild fires.
attributes.additional_details:
I’ve just seen a serious moorland fire which lasted for several
Days. It was started by a disposable barbecue left in a car park. Supposedly extinguished but resurrected by breezes. Causing risk to local
Property and residents, firefighters, farm animals and wild life

attributes.action: Enforce a limit on the cost of vehicle insurance for young and new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance in the UK has been continuously on the rise for several years. The cost of insurance for young drivers aged 17 years old even on low powered, low insurance grouped vehicles can run them up to the likes of £1500-£3000 with no cap. The average cost a new young driver will pay is around £2000
attributes.additional_details:
This has been a well known fact for many years that insurance companies have been picking out every penny they can from young and new drivers with no justification. The cost of insurance supercedes the price of many young drivers value of the car sometimes up to 5 times.
This is hindering young drivers from wanting to drive and becoming independent as the cost is becoming extortionate and is only rising every year. There needs to be a cap on the amount insurance companies can charge.

attributes.action: Make the Monday following remembrance Sunday a public holiday.
attributes.background: Every other EU country have a public holiday to remember out fallen. We should forward the same respect to our fallen and currently serving member of our armed forces.

attributes.action: Adopt the STV voting system for a more representative government.
attributes.background: Our current FPTP voting system is extremely flawed. The system has been in use for so long that, just like the USA, we are stuck in a two-party system that we will never be able to break out of.
attributes.additional_details:
Let’s imagine a new country adopts the system and holds the first election. The results are-
Blue- 27% of votes 
Green-32% of votes
Red-21% of votes
Yellow-20% of votes.
Green party wins with only 32% of the country’s representatives but is elected PM (68% of the country is unrepresented).
This is the system we have in the UK. 
I don’t have enough characters left to explain the benefits of STV, but please use these videos to learn-
https://youtu.be/P38Y4VG1Ibo
https://youtu.be/l8XOZJkozfI

attributes.action: Reject the Brexit Deal agreed by Theresa May and reopen negotiations immediately
attributes.background: Theresa May and her followers have negotiated a very poor and unfair deal for the UK. Her misguided deal would mean Northern Ireland would have different trade rules than the UK (thus endangering the Union). We would also not be allowed to leave the Backstop (Protocol) without the EU's agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
This deal needs to be rejected by the British people. It does not allow us freedom from the EU and binds our hands. It even agrees to extending the transition period if agreement can't be reached! 
 
It doesn't matter what party you vote for, or whether you are a Brexiteer or a Remainer, EVERYONE who cares for this country has to vote against this awful deal + sign this petition. Read the deal yourself and you'll be shocked at how much sovereignty we'd be giving away. SAVE THE UK!

attributes.action: Make 11 November a public holiday in remembrance of the two world wars.
attributes.background: In Britain we divide our remembrance between Remembrance Sunday that takes place on the nearest Sunday to 11 November and 11 November itself which recently has gained in importance. The designation or 11 November as a public holiday would do justice to the sacrifice that we try to remember.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has stood under the canopy of the Menin Gate in Ypres at 8 pm and heard the last post being sounded, as it has been every evening since 1924, save for the particular circumstances of the 2nd World War, cannot fail to be moved. The designation of 11 November as a national day of remembrance and a public holiday would allow us to do justice to the sacrifice of so many that took place100 years ago.

attributes.action: Apply national space standards to dwellings allowed by permitted development.
attributes.background: Under permitted development rights offices can be converted into residential units & planning authorities are not allowed to consider the size of the dwellings. This has meant dwellings being created of 15 & 16 sqm in size whereas the national space standards require 37 sqm for 1 adult.
attributes.additional_details: It has been reported that in one property in Barnet, for example, 96% of the 254 flats were smaller than the national minimum space standards with the smallest being 16 sqm. In many cases these will be used by more than one adult and even children and contain no outdoor amenity space. It is possible we are storing up a physical and mental health time bomb by creating dwellings of such a small size.

attributes.action: Regulate prescription fees from all UK veterinary surgeons.
attributes.background: Unregulated, vets can now charge what they like for writing prescriptions. A £5.00 standard charge should be made law to enable already over charged clients to purchase medications elsewhere such as a Animal chemist for often up to 800% cheaper than buying from a vet.
attributes.additional_details: Above information is easily checked by anyone having an invoice from their vet for medications and comparing same items on price with various animal chemists that are found on line.

attributes.action: Illegal for children under the age of 16 to purchase eggs
attributes.background: Following the recent devastating incidents and criminal damage that has been caused not only in my area but around the country with children throwing eggs at cars, houses and shops has created a big upset.
attributes.additional_details: A young boy has been left critically injured, after a group of children had thrown an egg, from the opposite side of the road, at a cars front windscreen which led the driver to not be able to see where they were going and innocently hitting a young boy, who was trick or treating with his friends, this has left him with a bleed to his brain and not knowing who his mum and other family members were. Just imagine the upset that the family is going through. I pray that Brendan has a speedy recovery

attributes.action: Stop insurers charging interest on monthly payments for motor premiums.
attributes.background: When taking out a motor insurance policy, you either pay for their premiums annually or monthly. However, often, monthly premiums attract high interest rates, making insurance more expensive. This is penalising low income families who can't afford to pay annually.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Traffic Act 1930 made it a legal requirement to hold a valid motor insurance policy if you drive a car on the public highway with at least third party cover. However, many on lower incomes, who rely on their car, have no choice but to pay monthly and therefore penalised with interest loaded on. The law should be changed so they cannot add interest. 

Insurers say it costs to process monthly payments, but considering Direct Line Group, for example, made a £293.8m pre-tax profit in the first half of 2018 (https://www.directlinegroup.com/~/media/Files/D/Direct-Line-Group-V2/reports-and-presentations/h1-results-2018-annoucement.pdf), it's unfair.

attributes.action: The government should stop ALL foreign aid now!
attributes.background: Issues at home are more important.
attributes.additional_details:
Foreign aid is given to India and they have a space programme 
Foreign aid is given to Pakistan, where Christians have been persecuted
Money should be spent on the NHS, pensions, policing etc.

attributes.action: Don't charge food businesses 20% VAT on turnover
attributes.background: I want the government to stop charging food businesses 20% VAT. The reason for this is because our industry has barely any VAT to claim back and yet we get charged that 20% on our turnover which is unfair compared to other industries. This ruins cash flow and causes business owners financial issues.

attributes.action: Government to provide further funding and resources to Veterans UK
attributes.background: Veterans UK administers the armed forces pension schemes & compensation payments for those injured or bereaved through service. In 2014, the Head of Veterans UK stated that the processing time for new claims was 4 months. In 2018, Veterans UK acknowledge that this it is now far in excess of this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/armed-forces-veterans-waiting-long-7572677.amp

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-28656924

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11035262/Are-we-failing-traumatised-war-veterans.html

attributes.action: Stop the closing of margate and ashford accident and emergency departments
attributes.background: There is current talk of closing qeqm and ashford accident and emergency as well as downgrading other departments such as maternity at qeqm this needs to be prevented people are going to die as a result. Having a super hospital 45 minutes away in Canterbury is not acceptable in an emergency

attributes.action: Should be a pets NHS. Not every1 can afford their pets ops and treatments
attributes.background: If you can't afford your pets operations or treatments they end up getting put down and its not fair. If your from a working class family it can be hard providing for your family as well as paying huge vet bills. Pets are part of the family!:)xxx
attributes.additional_details: please sign

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Change English law such that an offer on a house is a binding contract
attributes.background: Making it a more binding contract to offer on a house would help speed up moving house and prevent people spending thousands of pounds only for their buyer to withdraw or the seller to accept to a higher bid. This is how the system works in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Twice this year I have accepted offers on my property and spent money in solicitors fees only for them to pull out. I think once an offer is made on a property it should be made harder in law for a person to pull out of buying that property.

attributes.action: One Island-One Member of Parliament -please keep our single MP for Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
10 September 2018
Commission's "final recommendations" to divide the Island to have 2 MPs. This is divisive. We need one MP to speak for all of us. One Island - one MP!

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16832323.final-recommendations-for-isle-of-wight-parliamentary-constituencies-revealed/?ref=mr&lp=4
attributes.additional_details:
If you want one MP to support all of us as a united Island with one strong voice in Parliament, please support this petition. 

Thank you very much for your kind help.

attributes.action: Create a National Care Service
attributes.background:
This country needs a sister service to the NHS to focus on social care 

Care of vulnerable and elderly citizens 

Giving  social care a new and unique identity 

This new service would create new and specialised employment with career paths offering a rewarding career with decent pay
attributes.additional_details:
Social care has a poor image , often seen as low paid casual work 
But yet so vital in this age of an older generation 
A new identity a new structure 
With new career paths is needed

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Make smoking while driving illegal
attributes.background: The amount of people that have been killed in forest fires or road traffic collisions is astounding. This is all because someone throws their cigarette butt out of the window of the car. Or is not focusing while driving. I.e trying to light a cigarette.

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attackers.
attributes.background: The act must be premeditated for the attcker to come prepared with acid, the effects are often lifelong and severe, the attacker knows this. Let's put the victim first in this sickening act.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Free Meals For All Kids in Primary Schools
attributes.background: Kids in Primary School should have free Schools meals. If the Prisoners have free meals why kids can’t have them too.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that should be addressed and actioned! 
Please sign my petition and let all kids have a free warm meal at school.

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school
